item.title: Partnership for a new global AI discourse
item.description: THE advent of artificial intelligence marks a consequential inflection point in the trajectory of technological evolution. With AI-powered capabilities now available in the palms of our hand, breakthroughs across sectors are reshaping how societies function, economies grow and governments deliver services. The world that AI is enabling will be markedly different from......

item.title: Can Bangladesh reset its democracy?
item.description: THE recently concluded 13th general election marks one of the most consequential political turning points in Bangladesh’s contemporary history. The decisive victory of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party over the right-wing Jamaat-e-Islami Bangladesh–led 11-party alliance, under the leadership of Tarique Rahman, comes after nearly 15 years of increasingly authoritarian......

item.title: Invisible toxic industrial rise
item.description: INDUSTRIAL rise, powered by textiles, leather, chemicals and relentless urban expansion, has lifted incomes and created millions of jobs. That story is often told as one of success against poverty. But beneath that growth lies a quieter transformation: the country is entering a new era of environmental exposure defined not only by arsenic and salinity, but by emerging......

item.title: Can governance restore substance?
item.description: HISTORY is often kinder to opposition parties than to governments. In opposition, one speaks the language of ideals. In power, one must speak the language of consequences. The BNP has secured what many are calling a historic victory. Yet victory in a competitive election is not a coronation. It is a contract. And the terms of that contract are unusually severe......

item.title: Stability at stake as bank capital drops to record low
item.description: THE capital to risk-weighted assets ratio, which indicates the capital position of banks, reaching a record low signals a distress in the banking sector. Latest Bangladesh Bank data show that the capital to risk-weighted assets, or CRAR, ratio has plunged to 1.56 per cent, a fraction of the 10 per cent minimum mandated under Basel III framework. Such a collapse is not merely......Bangladesh cultural tours

item.title: BNP, Jamaat must end post-election violence
item.description: THE continued post-election violence is alarming, serving as a stark reminder of the contentious polls under the fallen regime and risking the long-held hope for a peaceful democratic transition. One more person died on February 14 and 31 others became injured in attacks and clashes linked to post-election violence in Bagerhat, Rajshahi, Natore, Gazipur and Sirajganj.......
